intro: Parodia cotacajensis, commonly known as the "Cotacajá Paddle Cactus," is a species of cactus native to Argentina. It is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems that are typically green to reddish in color. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are clustered at the tips of the stems. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable addition to botanical collections.
